Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> I think  the question is will the other players trust your table that you run? All the code is open source but if a table is full of colluding players, no amount of tech will solve that. The dealers that can create tables without colluders will have an advantage

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> all the nodes get all the encrypted data and after a hand it can be decrypted to verify it is valid

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> M players would have to collude to break the MofN encryption, with M set to be N/2+1

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> but from what I know in poker, just having two players colluding can influence the outcome significantly by their betting/folding without needing to break the encryption

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> so more than half. if you run a 6-player table, that means 4 need to collude to break encryption; the other 2 will notice that quite fast and will leave the table

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> yes, i did that too with friends. you can't stop that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> yes such tables wont be popular at all. the most popular dealers will have a mix of human players and not bots but also not 100% pros either

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> this is more a social problem and I dont see any magic tech that prevents  2 players from skyping privately their hole cards

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> no. maybe a reputation system that only allows reputable players

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> we can make the tech that enables blockchain enforced poker rules and cryptographically verifiable decks

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> leaves the question: how do you measure reputation

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> i think it needs to start with people playing with people they know, from that a reputation system can be created over time

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> coinpoker has a justice system. haven't looked at it closely

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> true

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> but outside of MofN collusion, the CHIPS wont enable any cheating that cant already be done

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> I assume there will be service providers eventually to provide a reputation, or maybe something like VRSC can be used

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> CHIPS will create the tech that allows anybody to setup a fair poker table

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> just like barterDEX allows anybody to be a bob

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> given a DB of hand history of all the players, it should be possible to get a pretty good indication of which pubkeys are honest and which ones are not

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> hmm yes, but you can always change pubkeys

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> but I think the best bot detector is the poker pro

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> true

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> a fresh pubkey becomes a newbie

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> dont trust newbies

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> the primary value a dealer might provide a table is bot detection and that could justify a higher rake

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> but really all this is getting way ahead of things. Once there is a large enough pool of players, reputation system, hand histories, it seems that this is a solvable matter. We still need to get the blockchain enforced payout to work. Making it so only the blockchain is holding table funds makes it trustless for the most important part

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> dealers wont have the real funds, just CHIPS satoshis being LN back and forth, so maybe a dishonest dealer can run off with 0.1 CHIPS, we ignore such silly dealers

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <Robert Naus> I see , so basically you start as a private friendly game and build your reputation and eventually people will trust you and play, itâ€™s a long process that will take years, but it may work at the end.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> gaining trust in the online poker community is going to be a marathon anyways

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <Robert Naus> Eventually you get like 100x if not 1000x of nodes running games and u can have very large players pool, especially if you able to somehow show all the nodes running and players playing so there is a large selection of games

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <Robert Naus> The fact that anyone can play from anywhere in the world is the major selling point, as this has been nearly impossible lately and will be totally shot down soon

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> yes. anyone can be a dealer, that's very cool

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> dealers that choose to publish their tables will be able to be seen by all the network

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> so we get public tables and private tables

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> totally decentralized

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> seems a good solution

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> and of course this will be a years long process

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> maybe some dealers invest money to jump start things

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> or maybe some smaller online poker company.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> regardless of the details of how things propagate, CHIPS is the coin

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> also poker is just one usecase, most other games can also be supported and that is where i expect a fair amount of third party solutions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> exactly why i created #pangea-poker , because i think you said this before: any game that uses a deterministically determined result, can be used as an application in the BET platform, right?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> yes

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> roullete, slot machines, etc. entire casino could be decentralized

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> maybe CHIPS are casino chips, not just poker chips

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <helios> why not starting project with simply game (roulette) and for the future biuld an entire casino

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> because solving decentralized poker is much more difficult and the idea is to make sure we can solve any decentralization problem. solving poker is a good indication we did. solving roullete, not so much

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> also I have no desire to build a casino, but rather build the tools that allow others to build their casinos

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <helios> good idea

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> Expect a dICO soon for the first truly decentralized casino

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> as a technology provider, our role is to provide the tech (with reference implementations)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> but let others make the money creating end user solutions

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <helios> do you have an idea for the mainnet release? When the mining is stopping (only 9k coin for mining) an event?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> testing hasn't even started

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> i think it's fair to say it's not gonna happen in 2018

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> mining will take a long time to fuly stop. halvings go on until 1 satoshi

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <helios> we hope testnet on 2018

Author: Mark81#4505
Content: Just read posts of colluding players. I thought simpless solution for that would be that player would not be allowed to choose on what table he sits. So it would be randomly selected and if player leaves table by trying to get into another table there would be precaution note  in next table for other players of  player that suffles between tables.

Author: Mark81#4505
Content: @jl777c

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [slack] <CrypToon> if the playerpool is small you are still very likely to end up on a table with someone you know, especially when multitabling

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [slack] <allbits> I think the main point is that in this decentralized technology it is up to dealers to innovate ways to make their tables more safe. And it is up to players to decide which solutions they prefer. There may emerge solutions that nobody has thought before. That is what is so powerful about offering a platform like this - it allows endless experimentation and innovation.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> certainly randomly assigning playrs to tables is one way, but it wont really work until there are a lot of players. also if bots somehow invade, then 90% of players can be bots. I think ultimately it will take human expert judgment to identify bots. if we get bots that play in a way that cant be differentiated from human play, then, well it passes the turing test so it deserves a seat at the table

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> I have a possible game to play based on https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=4465642.msg40036023#msg40036023

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> it has nothing to do with CHIPS, but it would be a game where the goal is to maximize the efficiency of your coins via clever allocation across the segments

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> if we can get more than a few people interested, we can start a new PoS chain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> for the game

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> do i see similarities to notary mining here?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> not really as there are no limits on staking, other than min utxo age

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> 64 is the same number as number of notaries though, there is that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> each of the 64 segments are a separate battle for staking, but after 128 seconds all segments are eligible

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> so the optimal allocation is to find all the segments with significantly less than average coins so it gets disproportionate staking

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> however, everybody likes free money so any segid that is significantly easy should get more coins added. that is the game

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> multiplayer and runs in parallel

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> we would need a tool that displays the total coins by segid

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> what's the reason for trying this? a better PoS?

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: I think it makes it so majority stake isnt enough for 51%

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: maybe 67% stake is needed, not sure the exact threshold

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> i'll definitely help out

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> maybe we need to create a channel and get people who want to help in there

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jorian> and spread it in komodo discord?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> since it is a game, I thought of CHIPS. we can promote free coins and a game/competition

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <crumb> can i be of any help if i'm not a coder?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> if you can send funds to addresses you can play the allocation game

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> basically the funds in each segid is your position and the game is to get a disproportionate return

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> form example, let us say the 90% stake holder is lazy and just has it all in one address

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [discord] <jl777c> and the 10% holder is more active and spreads his 10% across all the 64 segids. since 63/64 of the time the 10% stake holder is unopposed, he will win a disproportionate number of blocks, possible 3x or more than what he should get

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
